speaker: Nurse
text_entry: SCENE V. Capulet's orchard.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Enter JULIET

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: The clock struck nine when I did send the nurse;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: In half an hour she promised to return.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Perchance she cannot meet him: that's not so.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O, she is lame! love's heralds should be thoughts,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Which ten times faster glide than the sun's beams,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Driving back shadows over louring hills:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Therefore do nimble-pinion'd doves draw love,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And therefore hath the wind-swift Cupid wings.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Now is the sun upon the highmost hill

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Of this day's journey, and from nine till twelve

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Is three long hours, yet she is not come.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Had she affections and warm youthful blood,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: She would be as swift in motion as a ball;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: My words would bandy her to my sweet love,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And his to me:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: But old folks, many feign as they were dead;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Unwieldy, slow, heavy and pale as lead.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O God, she comes!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Enter Nurse and PETER

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O honey nurse, what news?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Hast thou met with him? Send thy man away.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Peter, stay at the gate.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Exit PETER

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Now, good sweet nurse,--O Lord, why look'st thou sad?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Though news be sad, yet tell them merrily;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: If good, thou shamest the music of sweet news

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: By playing it to me with so sour a face.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I am a-weary, give me leave awhile:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Fie, how my bones ache! what a jaunt have I had!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I would thou hadst my bones, and I thy news:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Nay, come, I pray thee, speak; good, good nurse, speak.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Jesu, what haste? can you not stay awhile?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Do you not see that I am out of breath?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: How art thou out of breath, when thou hast breath

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: To say to me that thou art out of breath?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: The excuse that thou dost make in this delay

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Is longer than the tale thou dost excuse.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Is thy news good, or bad? answer to that;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Say either, and I'll stay the circumstance:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Let me be satisfied, is't good or bad?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Well, you have made a simple choice; you know not

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: how to choose a man: Romeo! no, not he; though his

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: face be better than any man's, yet his leg excels

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: all men's; and for a hand, and a foot, and a body,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: though they be not to be talked on, yet they are

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: past compare: he is not the flower of courtesy,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: but, I'll warrant him, as gentle as a lamb. Go thy

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: ways, wench; serve God. What, have you dined at home?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: No, no: but all this did I know before.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: What says he of our marriage? what of that?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Lord, how my head aches! what a head have I!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: It beats as it would fall in twenty pieces.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: My back o' t' other side,--O, my back, my back!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Beshrew your heart for sending me about,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: To catch my death with jaunting up and down!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I' faith, I am sorry that thou art not well.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Sweet, sweet, sweet nurse, tell me, what says my love?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Your love says, like an honest gentleman, and a

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: courteous, and a kind, and a handsome, and, I

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: warrant, a virtuous,--Where is your mother?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Where is my mother! why, she is within;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Where should she be? How oddly thou repliest!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: 'Your love says, like an honest gentleman,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Where is your mother?'

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: O God's lady dear!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Are you so hot? marry, come up, I trow;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Is this the poultice for my aching bones?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Henceforward do your messages yourself.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Here's such a coil! come, what says Romeo?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Have you got leave to go to shrift to-day?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I have.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Then hie you hence to Friar Laurence' cell;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: There stays a husband to make you a wife:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Now comes the wanton blood up in your cheeks,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: They'll be in scarlet straight at any news.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Hie you to church; I must another way,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: To fetch a ladder, by the which your love

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Must climb a bird's nest soon when it is dark:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I am the drudge and toil in your delight,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: But you shall bear the burden soon at night.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Go; I'll to dinner: hie you to the cell.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Hie to high fortune! Honest nurse, farewell.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Exeunt
